items.title: St. Peter
items.summary: The fisherman called to be the 'Rock' of the Church and the first Pope.

items.title: St. Andrew
items.summary: The first-called Apostle and brother of Peter, known for his missionary zeal.

items.title: St. James Major
items.summary: The first Apostle to be martyred and a member of Jesus' inner circle.

items.title: St. John
items.summary: The Beloved Disciple and Evangelist who stood at the foot of the Cross.

items.title: St. Philip
items.summary: The Apostle who led Nathanael to Christ and requested to see the Father.

items.title: St. Thaddeus
items.summary: Also known as Jude, the patron saint of lost causes and desperate situations.

items.title: St. Bartholomew
items.summary: Recognized as Nathanael, the Israelite 'in whom there is no guile.'

items.title: St. Thomas
items.summary: Famous for his initial doubt, he later confessed 'My Lord and my God.'

items.title: St. James Less
items.summary: Author of the Epistle of James and a key leader in the early Church in Jerusalem.

items.title: St. Matthew
items.summary: The former tax collector who left everything to follow Jesus and write the Gospel.

items.title: St. Simon
items.summary: Known as the Zealot, he preached the Gospel with great fervor across many lands.

items.title: Judas Iscariot
items.summary: The disciple who betrayed Jesus, leading to the events of the Passion.
